text: Waverley is a future provincial electoral district (riding) in the Canadian province of Manitoba that will come into effect at the 2019 Manitoba general election. It will elect one member to the Legislative Assembly of Manitoba. The riding was created by the 2018 provincial redistribution out of part of St. Norbert and Fort Whyte. The riding contains the Winnipeg neighbourhoods of Waverley West, Waverley Heights and part of Montcalm. ==Election results== {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="4" | 2016 provincial election redistributed results |- ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="130px" colspan="2" | Party ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="30px" | % |- | | | Progressive Conservative ||align=right| 54.9 |- | | | New Democratic ||align=right| 27.4 |- | | | Liberal ||align=right| 13.7 |- | | | Green ||align=right| 2.5 |- | | | Others ||align=right| 1.4 |} ==References== Category:Manitoba provincial electoral districts Category:Politics of Winnipeg
title: Waverley (electoral district)
